intro: Caiophora stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit caiophora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a small, spherical drupe with a thick, leathery outer layer. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
